definition: to set sail/to brave the waves
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions
lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)

sentences.english: They came over to the stem and watched the ship cutting a feather.
sentences.chinese: 他们来到船头，看着航船破浪前进。

sentences.english: Winds and waves stop sometimes, hoisting the sails to travel in the vast sea.
sentences.chinese: 长风破浪终有时，直挂云帆济沧海。

sentences.english: The ship forged ahead through the waves.
Timmerman showed him how it was built to sail against the wind and turn into the waves.
sentences.chinese: 提莫曼给他说明了如何造船才能乘风破浪而行。

sentences.english: If the wave has already broken, don't try to go through the whitewater that results.
sentences.chinese: 如果波浪已经破浪了，不要试着穿过激浪。

sentences.english: The great ship ploughed across the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 巨轮在大洋中破浪前进。

sentences.english: The long breeze ride the waves a meeting sometimes, hangs cloud sail benefit sea.
sentences.chinese: 长风破浪会有时，只挂云帆济沧海。

sentences.english: The ship of China-US relations, moored for so long, again set sail, braving the wind and waves.
sentences.chinese: 停航许久的中美关系大船又乘风破浪启航了。

sentences.english: The ship buffeted her way through the waves.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船乘风破浪地前进。

sentences.english: As the "Bonadventure" no longer existed, six months at least would be required for the construction of a new vessel.
sentences.chinese: 乘风破浪号已经没有了，造一只新船至少要六个月。

sentences.english: The ship ploughed slowly around the bay.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船缓慢的破浪前进，使过海湾。

sentences.english: Scuttling across the floors of silent seas.
sentences.chinese: 破浪疾行于宁静海的地面。

sentences.english: The ship ploughed through the waves.
South China City Center Building, like a sail, a symbol of the winds and waves of the helmsman.
sentences.chinese: 华南城中心大厦，像个船帆，象征着乘风破浪的舵手。

sentences.english: The ship knifed through the heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 船在汹涌的海面上破浪前进。

sentences.english: My boat was surged through the huge waves.
sentences.chinese: 我的小船颠簸着破浪前进。

definition: lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)
to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions
to ride the wind/to use a fair wind/to take an opportunity
sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods
